data.text: I've used both. The moloko tends to push you more into a forward lean, similar to a road bike geometry when used on the same stem as the jones bar. I didn't find them as comfortable as the Jones. I now use neither and have swapped to the Koga Denham which puts you more upright like an mtb bar, but the back sweep is perfect and the hand position on the forward lean is so comfortable. All are oddly expensive! If you run a front rack and basket setup both Jones and Moloko bars push the cables into the front basket area which is also super annoying! Just depends how you set your sweet rig up!

data.text: Recently been trialling a clone of the Jones Loop bar, the On One Geoff, and it's given me unbearable hand and wrist pains/twinges unlike any I've had before with flat/drop bars within 20-25km. I find the 45 degree sweep to be really aggressive and awkward, even though it seems to be in the right position for my set-up. Maybe it's my bike fit? Possibly might be worth trying a bar without as much sweep.
